column5: Crappies so shallow their back fin is out of the water..

I walk my dog every morning and its awesome to see the changes of seasons  for me it was the arrival of birds every morning it seemed a new species showed up at the park. The cardinals came first, then the sparrows, then the robins. After that rain last week the nightcrawlers were out and the robins were gorging.
I thought for sure your reply would have been something else. I guess we can discuss it at the spot in a few weeks. I'll make sure you get your syrup this year  S.
Wayne, you just took my parking spot!

I thought for sure your reply would have been something else. I guess we can discuss it at the spot in a few weeks. I'll make sure you get your syrup this year  S. You are soooooo  correct my friend. Pretty hard to just pick one thing that makes it spring. That spot means spring to me with regards to fishing. Probably my favourite place on the planet for 1-2 weeks every year. I'm thinking it will be a month away rather then a few weeks but it will come.  The maple syrup would be a nice added bonus. I hear it goes good will a pail of perch cream
Yeah, a few weeks was me being an optimist lol
Well we had a blizzard warning here yesterday. High winds and a little snow but it was fairly warm. Now it's -26 with -40 wind chill. I'm sittin' on the couch watchin' hockey.
For me its the first day I can't wear a coat
For me its the first day I can't wear a coat  I wear shorts most of the winter LOL
Hey I'm coming with you guys this year lol
Hey I'm coming with you guys this year lol  That would be perfect. Can't happen soon enough for me.
I wear shorts most of the winter LOL   OMG.............until now I never believed in BIG FOOT ! ! !
We have snowdrop flowers coming up in the front yard this wknd.
We have snowdrop flowers coming up in the front yard this wknd.  Must be nice. I just have husky sized poopcicles in mine!!
It's now official for me. The wild garlic is up about two inches. Woohoo lol.  Cheers
14 hour days in the hangar is usually a fair sign that it's Spring around here...
Green instead of brown.
Channel cats and crappie. I love this time of year
Jays home opener.
Leafs on the golf course!!!

The sure sign of spring here is when the first batch of skitters arrives. Usually there is still ice on the lakes and these slow, dumb pterodactyl sized skitters hatch. They are easy to defend against since they are slow and the numbers are low. The later hatches are another story. They are small fighter plane fast bugs that come in huge squadrons!!!!
While out this evening I heard spring peepers and saw big, tom Turkeys in full strut showing off for their hens...what a display!
The buzzards are back here, I moved so slow I am afraid to go outside now! LOL
Went for a walk lastnight on my fav trib, found some tiny fiddleheads!  Spring is in the air
While out this evening I heard spring peepers and saw big, tom Turkeys in full strut showing off for their hens...what a display! I can help alleviate that problem if you'd like

Thanks for the kind offer! Think I'll be able to manage somehow though! ?They'll probably be scarce once the season opens anyway...that's how it always goes, but last night they were definitely out in full force.
Leafs on the golf course!!! I have heard of these things call "golf course" but never really seen one. A friend of mine heard they were built for those who failed at fishing......
or this
that summer spincast.  spring is when jordan is still frozen.  soon my friend, soon.
Sitting on the side of my atv in the march sunshine jigging up jumbo perch.  Got my fix of that today!
that summer spincast.  spring is when jordan is still frozen.  soon my friend, soon. true, but in Canada, the shoulder seasons are known for their brevity

Yup...  We call em bullhead... They're small catfish.... A 2 pounder would be big  They come in the creeks and bite day and night... So you can fish em whenever you want... All you need is a hook and worm. and weight... I like using a float too...
Spring for me starts when I see my first robin. Yes we get them this far North. Thats what does it for me. Get goose bumps when I hear the first one sing.

Yup...  We call em bullhead... They're small catfish.... A 2 pounder would be big  They come in the creeks and bite day and night... So you can fish em whenever you want... All you need is a hook and worm. and weight... I like using a float too...  I know what they are lol, I just didn't know they came into the creeks so early. Or that they had a "run". I'll have to check em out whilst I'm waiting for other species to open

For me it is Robins, seeing the deer come out from the bush trying to forage.... Had 14 this afternoon...  And the sound of the ice/snow running down the downspout from the eves..... Love that sound.  G
Robins in the yard and pussy willow buds.

I was just out on the back deck and it's raining and 1st thing I thought of was this post.  Nice mild temps and the 1st rain of the year is always a good sign that winter is on the way out...and that's a good thing
The first boat launch of the year means SPRING is finally here for "me".
Spring peepers,otherwise known as tree frogs. When the bush around here resonates with the sounds of their mating calls I know spring has truly sprung.

I always enjoy the winter months, but for the first time in a long time I am really anticipating spring this year! Like mentioned in a previous post, I'm sure this mild weather is just a preview but I'm liking what I see so far! Can't wait to hear those Spring Peepers, then it's official.
SUNSETS we only get them in the spring and the fall, beautiful one last night
The iced up septic vent thawed and the house smells fresh again.  Taxes.  The boat and trailer come off the blocks.  Just to name a few.
For me, spring starts when the temperature rises above zero, the snow starts melting, and you can see the first signs of grass.

Yup  I've seen them school up in creeks in such numbers that if you drive your boat up the creek you have hundreds of them swimming and jumping in front of the boat... Almost like Asian carp..  They also school up in bays..  As a starting point... Anywhere I've found crappie there have been bullhead around
my cat gets outside for the first time in months and brings back a freshly-killed bird within 2 minutes...new record

2 things that make it "spring" for me. One.... first time my tiller gets out and tills up my veggie garden. Nothing better then a spring day with the tiller going, birds chirping and the smell of freshly tilled earth. God I love that day every year. Two...when my tarragon plants at the back door are about 12 inches tall. That means bullheads and crappie are a no brainer in a couple of my spring spots
For me, spring starts when I can launch my boat at the lake of my choice. This was my chosen launch last May long. Yup. One week from June. So spring starts in June for me.

For me, spring starts when I can launch my boat at the lake of my choice. This was my chosen launch last May long. Yup. One week from June. So spring starts in June for me.   Seen this before and love this photo thx for sharing.
That spots so much nicer in August Dan!!
That spots so much nicer in August Dan!!    Yup. That's the place Wayne.
Looks like we took a step backwards overnight as everything is covered in a light dusting of snow this morning, but thankfully it'll be gone again once the sun comes up....hopefully LOL
there was no snow here last night.  some of my signs are

Heard my first Redwing singing along the creek behind work today...what a glorious sound! Also saw a couple groundhogs out today and some motorcyclists...sure signs of spring in my book. What does it for you?

I've been working outside around the house the last 4 days wearing shorts & running shoes and that's always a good thing.  Also nice having the warm sun coming thru the windows and not needing the furnace.

yesterday, opened a few windows after turning down the thermostat, heard a redwing and a grackle this morning, i'd say we are at least getting a preview. not going to pack up the snowblower yet though.
Birds chirping all around my house.  Love it
Smell of skunk on the way to work tuesday morning
I hear birds. Maybe that's why my "wifes" cat won't come in. Saw a healthy coyote walking across the ice today. To bad he didn't see the cat.
It's not Spring till the first blackfly bite.

Redwing blackbirds in our trees, followed by the Robins and then the orioles.  They all come in about 7 days of each other usually. Pretty sure I saw a Redwing buzzing across the highway on Thursday.The should be yodeling out back any day now
Its officially spring when the sap starts flowing. That was sunday at my place. Lots of new birds around too.  S.
Spring for me starts when I see my first robin. Yes we get them this far North.
Sap running

Was able to leave a couple windows open for most of the day earlier in the week.  Definitely was a nice preview, but its not spring to me until I can put a boat in the water.  The 15 cm of snow were in the process of getting right now sure put a damper on the whole spring thing lol
Seen a white swan on Wednesday flying over the lake. Know of no open water in the area.
When the red/silver maples grow their "balloons".
Also, when the suckers stack up in the creeks
Couple black and orange caterpillars  at the front door yesterday. Seems a bit early for them.
March 21st...  What an easy question... Lol  Once the geese show up that's the start of carpin for me....  When the buds on trees start to open thats my sign for the bullhead runs...
where do the bullhead run? up the creeks like the others?
I'll know for sure when:
Dog poop emerging from the snow!!
landmines from my Labrador. redwings grackles robins. have not heard a killdeer yet. god I love spring.
first sign of spring? me catching browns before the lake fills with lugans!
You beat me to it! For me it's the fiddleheads, robins and little early black stoneflies in the snow.
I got partidge in my yard as I type.  Its already spring in my mond when its + temps everyday
usually when I swallow the first bug.
